captions.text: Gelousie asks
What made you decide to just do blogging and give up teaching if you loved it so much?
Were you skeptical about it at first?
At which point did you decide that you could actually make money from blogging?
For some of you who are new to eatyourkimchi
and you restarted watching our videos
and some of you have been watching us from the beginning
We feel sorry for you
Embarrassing actually...
Our videos suck....really suck
This is really good chance to explain it to people how we are blogging full time now
what we were doing before,
and how the heck we got to this point
YES!
Both of us are certified as high school teachers in Canada
and we came to Korea to be teachers as well
But when we came here first though
we set up a blog to show up our families what life is like in Korea
because after all they had no idea what it was like
and was worried about us
In fact, I'm sure that a lot of you planning coming to Korea
are already experiencing these problems with your friends and families who are like,
"Don't go!! ~~~ No water!! You can't do stuff there!!!"
"What's KPOP?"
So from D-1 we started to blog, just as a hobby, for ourselves and for our families
Then something really weird happened
Very weird...
People started to subscribe our videos
and we both were like
WHY???
WHO...WHY WOULD SOMEONE SUBSCRIBE?
WE ARE SO BORING AND NERDY
WHO IS THAT PERSON??
I DON'T UNDERSTAND...
Coming to think of it, 4 and a half years
WHY ARE YOU WATCHING OUR VIDEOS??
WE ARE SO NERDY AND WEIRD...
DORKY.....I DON'T UNDERSTAND
ME NIETHER
So some of you know that part of our history
but a lot of people don't know is that, during my 2 years of teacher in Korea
I had a really rough time as a teacher
Meemers said it was a rough time also...
So then I thought, since we are getting in more popular
What if I decided to work as full-time for a year while Martina teaches for her 3rd year
which ....
Actually what you meant to say was that I was your sugar mama for you
Buy me this T-shirt!!
Give me some money!!! I'm so hungry!!!
Home in my pjs working on my website while my wife brings home the money
Our website..was not actually making any money after 2years..
It had potential ... but for those few months after I started to do this for full time
REALLY....TOUGH TIMES...
So the big goal for us to be were just able to work together
like if we were both teachers we are in separate schools but we love each other a lot
and we wanna be with each other all the time
so why don't we have a job while we can work with each other all the time
This is really like our rookie groupy year
We only had one salary coming in, which was my salary
We had to pay the half the rent since you weren't a teacher anymore
We were still paying off for our student loans
we would run out money by the end of the month because we had to pay our bills
We would have no food to eat
Yes we were not eating for....last week of the month
EVERYTHING!!!
It was our rookie group year ..so much ramen
SO MUCH RAMEN.....
It was a really hard year for us
By the end of Martina's 3rd year of teaching, that was when we realized
"Yes, she could quit teaching, we both could live off the blog!
Yes it was going to be more difficult because we would be cutting off her salary as a teacher as well
But it's something we can do, we tighten our belts and can get through it!!"
And we wouldn't eat
And a lot of people don't realize is that, it was a really stressful 2 years for us really
cuz it's a risky thing to do,
we are not on a contract, we weren't being paid monthly by someone
It's risky, if our videos flop.. then we are not getting paid or
if people stop liking us and everyone unsubscribes and leaves....
then we'll become lonely and we'll be out on the streets and have a homeless cup and we'll be really sad
So to clarify, we are not actually hired by any company
the Korean government doesn't give us any money,
no music industry is giving us money
we are just working off as Youtube partnership and our own website ads
And also this is just two of us, we don't have a PR team
we don't have a staff of camera men or video editors,
we don't have makeup artists, we don't have stylist , we don't have writers
we are just two of us
"We can make it if we try ~~~
JUST THE TWO OF US~~
YOU AND I
Don't forget about me guise~~
Spudgy works hard also
Just the three of us~~
Meemers...
JUST THE FOUR OF US~~
And when i decided not to return to my school for 4th year.
it was actually really really hard for me
I cried and cried and cried
and for the first 6, 7 months I'll say
"I'm still a teacher....I'm not used to this blogging thing"
She would keep talking about her students
You don't have anymore students....
YOUR STUDENTS ARE ALL DEAD...
I didn't say that they were all dead, I'm not that mean
So the big question that everyone wants to know
"How is it possible to make money from blogging?"
Actually this is quite simple, when you watch our videos in Youtubes
you see like a preroll ad or ad at the bottom or ad on the side,
or if you visit our websites you see the ads on the side as well
we make money for those ads
The more people watch our videos, the more people visit our sites
the more money we make
Except, if you are one of those people who use ad blocks that you don't see any ads
which we make no money whatsoever which means...
Every time you use ad blocks, you visit our site or watch our videos
Spudgy goes hungry
You want Spudgy to be hungry?
Is that what you want?
And especially you China, because we know that sites download our videos and re upload them
so we make no money out of it
China...I've got eye on you....
You are watching these videos for free..
for small exchange, watch an ad at the beginning of the video
Can you say that in more cooperate ways?
No..
Now we really appreciate of the fans support that people buy our T-Shirts
because that T-Shirt money goes to us and you don't had to buy those T-Shirts
like you can keep watching those videos for free
Those direct support of us and sites and we really appreciate that and thank you very much
And if you guys can't afford the shirts we don't wanna put pressure on people
Just thank you for watching our videos in general
Just by watching our video you are giving your support that way as well,
and Spudgy food and Meemersworth pats and kisses
So currently we are trying to get a business visa in Korea that we could set up eatyourkimchi as a business
and we are saving up money to apply for it
because getting business visas is not cheap...
and it takes a long time to apply it and we could not do it outside of Korea
and we've been working on this for awhile
What we are hoping to do is that actually set up a business that we could actually hire editors
that could help us with the workload and we could maybe hire a videographer help us out as well
It's totally awesome guys
We want to get more video segments for you guys
we have so many ideas and things we wanna do,
just don't have enough time and for those of you who edit videos
you know that it is the most time vampire in the world!
Like if we film one video, a WANK, it could take us like 8 hours to film
and then editing, that could be 6 to 10 hours, exporting and uploading it
It could take us a day or an a half for one video
Literally we don't have enough time in the day for one video but we do it
So this is our very long answer to this really complicated question
I hope you have a better understanding what we are doing now
You can check on our blog post on our website for more details about it
we don't wanna just ramble on and on in this video
30 minutes!!
So that's for this week's TL;DR
If you have a question for next TL;DR, leave your question on the comment section below
or you can check out the question that are already asked, and you can thumb them up
and hope we notice that question and choose it
And don't forget to subscribe for more TL;DRs
and not to watch us video with ad block
Cuz it would make us really sad
and Spudgy very sad
and Meemers really sad
HEY AD BLOCK!

comments.author: CF-105 Games

comments.text:
+CF-105 Games =))))) lmfao upped your comment cause it was so funny reading 
it :))))
comments.author: Mischa Vladimir

comments.text:
+CF-105 Games I don't watch PewDiePie and other than him I've never heard 
of any of the others. None of my friends watch him/them either. I don't 
mind some vlogers because there are people who don't have the money or time 
to go to big places like Disney land or and different country and it's nice 
to see what it's like.

I understand where you are coming from and for some points I agree. But the 
CEO's would've had to work there asses off just to get that promotion or to 
build up their company the ones who automatically get it from family and 
friends those are the ones I don't like.

Now musicians and actors... to a degree. People follow their lives and 
stalk them if there really famous. 1 wrong word and their whole career can 
go down the drain, so I don't feel as good for putting down there price a 
whole lot.

Soldiers and doctors. I do agree that they should get a higher pay check 
but there are some really bad soldiers and soma really bad doctors that 
don't deserve that at all. They don't deserve to be called a doctor or a 
soldier, but if we raise the bar to much then not too many people will want 
to do those things, but we'd need to raise the bar up if they're gonna be 
paid more.

But if we think about it if everyone was paid the exact same amount of 
money, why would someone try to get that higher role where they have to do 
even more work? That doesn't seem all that fare.

Overall there isn't really anything as fare. We take life as it is and we 
have to suffer through it. There isn't going to be any change any time 
soon. Things will become corrupt and companies will fall to the ground, but 
there isn't really anything a few hundred people can do, not without going 
to the extreme, and even doing that wouldn't help. I'm young so in full 
honesty I don't really know a lot (Barely anything really) but I do know 
that nothing is going to change any time soon.
comments.author: Little GAMA

comments.text:
+Little GAMA

I am standing my ground as well. Certain people deserve the money they get, 
those are the ones who are sadly buried on this site though by the rest 
like Pewdiepie, RTU,DSP and the likes. Sorry but Vlogs aren't worthy of 
getting money either.

As for the actors comment you made, I don't think they should get the 
amount of money they get either. Neither do sports stars, musicians 
shouldn't either.
Hell the CEO's of companies shouldn't get paid as much for the little they 
do, and when they fuck up they shouldn't get golden parachutes either like 
the ex-CEO of Target getting a 75 million exit fee. The world is broken in 
my opinion, too many of the wrong kind of people get paid tons while people 
like doctors and soldiers who do far more get allot less.
comments.author: CF-105 Games

comments.text:
+CF-105 Games Sorry, calling you a 'dumbass' and 'the dumbest person on 
YouTube' aren't things I should call you... it's not polite and I'm sorry 
for that. I really don't know why I said it. But everything else I have 
said is true and I stand ground against my words even if I haven't 
explained them like I mean.
comments.author: Little GAMA

comments.text:
+CF-105 Games 1) Good job for you... so why do you have it if you don't 
like it?

2) I never said that life is for free and I agree, nothing in life is for 
free... except coupons and gifts from stores (I can't remember the name). 
Life sucks and people need jobs to survive. I'm just saying that YouTube is 
a job, and it's the same as Directors. There are some/most movies that you 
might hate but others absolutely love or some directors and even actors 
that you feel the same way and others the opposite. Through other peoples 
eyes they are the ones that they will follow even as there ship goes down. 
You mightn't find them funny or entertaining but other people do and it's 
the exact same thing for movies.

3) I'm sorry if it sounded like I was saying that YouTube would manage to 
'disable Add Blockers' or something but I mean that they will figure out 
another way to pay the YouTubers. For example a really good YouTube channel 
has millions of subscribers and gets millions of views but they don't get 
much money because of Add Blockers. So they might try and find another way 
around it. So maybe if a subscriber watches a video depending on how much 
they watch their videos and for how long they may give them money.

4) But thats the thing, we're humans and even though we know that these 
things will end we try our hardest to keep them alive, to live longer. The 
internet was supposed to never really worked but here it is. People never 
actually thought that a computer would be popular and that millions of 
people would buy them. But guess what, they are. Yes some things die out 
and most of the time people give up on them, but if/when YouTube dies 
something different will be created heck other things are being created 
right now and some are on the web right now. We create new things it's what 
we do. And if what you say is true when do you think we will really stop 
making new content? Or making things better? 10 years? 100 years? whatever 
you say it's a 1 in... well a long number that it's right. Oh, and sure in 
your opinion I'm the stupid one. But for me... your the dumbass.
comments.author: Little GAMA

comments.text:
+Little GAMA

1) I have had this account since Youtube pretty much began.

2) I don't owe anyone anything. Life isn't free, no one in life owes you a 
free living. Sure there are people on youtube that make videos and deserve 
to be paid, those are the people I turn my adblock off for. But people like 
Let's Players, people who read the video game news for views such as 
ReviewtechUSA, people who act like complete dumbasses like Boogie and his 
Francis character, they don't deserve to be paid. Sorry but that is not 
real work.

3) You honestly think youtube will find a way around adblock. Are you 
serious? The open source community is the one that created the adblock in 
the first place, and they have taken companies to Microsoft to task and 
produced better software than even the richest corporations. You are 
talking about a community that turned a hobby OS Linux into something that 
runs 98% of the internet servers in the world and produces a OS that even 
Value along with other companies are taking notice as the user base grows. 
This same community has helped create the worlds leading mobile OS android. 
The same community that found a way to play Netflix on Linux when Netflix 
themselves weren't going to allow it. The same community which has created 
WINE which can run Windows applications in Linux and that improves every 2 
weeks. You think Google is going to beat them? Forget it, people like Hulu 
and Blip tried and failed miserably. They may get it blocked for a short 
while but the community will ALWAYS beat them. It's just a fact of life.

You are the moron here my friend. You think that people Boogie deserve to 
be paid huge dollars for acting like a fucking spaz, you are the one who 
needs to live in the real world. The youtube bubble will crash, it's 
already beginning to crash as Google themselves have said they are not 
making money off youtube despite the billions of views. They are making it 
harder and harder for the "content creators" to make money off this site 
without giving them a bigger cut. Eventually Google is going to say fuck it 
and give these guys nothing, nowhere does it say they have to, and the 
bubble will burst. Then people like DSP,RTU, Boogie are going to have to 
face the real world again. Just like the housing bubble in 2004, it looked 
like the good times will never end, everyone was making huge money on wall 
street and then October 2008 the bubble burst. Same thing happened in the 
late 90's and early 2000's with the dot com bubble in which it was to never 
end and that bubble burst. It's happened time and time and time again 
throughout human history, you are just too stupid to realize it.
comments.author: CF-105 Games

comments.text:
...Okay, so you don't owe Anyone squat. So you don't owe your mother the 
fact that you where born, you don't owe anyone for being friends with you, 
or the actors giving you entertainment. You don't owe your boss for giving 
you a job. Right now you sound like the dumbest person on YouTube. If you 
don't like it leave it alone.

YouTube isn't going to crumble it's getting bigger and the fact that you 
made an account helps it, the fact that you are posting comments shows that 
you care and it gives it a boost. Instead of letting it crumble like you 
want it to your giving it a better structure, your helping YouTube finalise 
the faults. Sure you use add blocker but that just means that YouTube will 
create a way around it. The fact that you use it gives them the opportunity 
to use it as an advantage.

Creating content on YouTube is the same, if not even better, than movies. 
There are actors, there's editing, sound effects etc. So if you don't class 
YouTube as working than nothing except construction work and possibly 
teaching are 'proper' jobs as they possibly use the lest amount of time on 
a computer.
comments.author: Little GAMA

comments.text:
+BehindScars

I feel bad for you. Haven't learned a thing about the world, always feeling 
entitled. Sorry but the world isn't here to cater to you. It's either you 
survive or you don't. It's really that simple. You want something, YOU go 
earn it, don't expect everyone to hand it to you.
comments.author: CF-105 Games

comments.text: Just know that Karma is coming for you man. Whether or not you even care.
comments.author: Born Hater

comments.text:
+OutSpeak Debate

You are right, I don't hate all youtubers and I reward the ones that do put 
out a good product.
But for every good youtuber there are 20 bad ones such as 
DSP,ReviewtechUSA,Linkara (well he is blip but same shit) that put out a 
lazy product and have legions of idiots who follow them. There needs to be 
reform on this site where the good people who put the work into their 
content say like Ebola World get more than the people like RTU who just 
rips off gaming news websites to cash in. But no Google doesn't seem to 
care because it's all about greed. It's all about the clicks and the views.

Sorry but blogging is not a real job, anyone can do it and be successful. I 
would do it if I had the slightest interest in talking to the entire world 
about my problems or if I ate a sandwhich today or whatever. Just like I am 
against celebs, sports athletes, journalists who make more money than 
people who are out there say protecting our freedom such as soldiers, or 
doctors who are helping sick people, or fireman who have to go into burning 
buildings to help people and put out fires or Good police officer (not the 
bad ones) who have to deal with societys problems, those are the people who 
deserve the bigger money yet don't get it because society for stupid reason 
seems to value youtubers,actors and actresses, sports athletes, bloggers 
and so forth than them who when the shit hits the fan they come crying to. 
That is what bugs me.

As for self-esteem, I have plenty of it. I look at things logically and 
seeing people making tons of money for doing basically nothing pisses me 
off because it's a drain on the system.
comments.author: CF-105 Games

comments.text:
Dude, that's really really sad that you'd get joy out of the idea that 
people would lose their jobs and be forced to do things they'd rather do 
less. The only reason I could think why anyone would want that for other 
people is because there is a deep void in their life and a sense of 
frustration with your own life and work. These people create something 
people love, I love it, and evidently enough other people love it that 
Simon and Martina (and their awesome crew) can do it professionally. 

(just so we're clear, I think Justin Beiber has a better chance of becoming 
president of Mexico than the bottom falling out of Youtube revenue streams)

Your hatred of Youtubers is about as logical as a hatred of doctors who 
just help people 'for the money'. Greedy buggers, providing a service that 
is in depend. How dare they receive some of the profits that Youtube 
generate from their traffic!

It's a really thin act to be honest, it really just sounds like you hate to 
see other people be successful because you have no self-esteem. You 
shouldn't take it out on others though, I don't know you or anything but 
I'm pretty sure you could do better dude. You don't seem half as dumb as 
most youtube haters.
comments.author: OutSpeak Debate 토론

comments.text:
+OutSpeak Debate

Or I am not stupid enough to fall for these sob stories. Youtube was better 
when people were doing it for a hobby, not just to cash in.

I can't wait for the day when the bottom falls out and the whole full time 
youtubers will have to come back to the real world. I look forward to the 
laughter I am going to have when that day comes.
comments.author: CF-105 Games

comments.text:
+snake2006 Alright, so at first I asked because I assumed you were a fan 
and thought your stance was strange. It's not strange to me now. I 
completely disagree with you in a couple different places but I'm ok with 
that.

It's rude to curse at people just because you disagree with them. For 
someone who just spent a paragraph outlining the demise of a better time on 
the internet, I find ironic how quick you are to act like a stereotypical 
rude youtube commenter. 

I have no clue why writing rude comments is the best use of your time right 
now. I'm happy using this time to defend Martina and Simon's wonderful work 
because I dig their stuff.

I hate corp. greed too bro but content SHOULD'T be damned, it's important. 
To me, and a bunch of other people, it's awesome that Youtube has 
facilitated them to create this business.You don't have to comment and be 
rude to real people just because you see things differently, it's ugly 
behaviour. This really just sounds like a simple case of haters gonna hate.
comments.author: OutSpeak Debate 토론

comments.text:
+OutSpeak Debate

I don't consider making internet videos a real job.
I don't watch their videos, hell I barely watched any of this one. Friends 
of mine keep sending me this crap.

I am proud I am undermining the system. I don't owe these people anything. 
Neither do you. I remember the internet before it got so fucking greedy and 
commercial. It was a place where knowledge and people came together just to 
talk and share things. Now it's become a commercial farce with everyone 
trying to make oodles of cash, content be damned.

Hell Youtube was better BEFORE the partner and networks and patreons 
started, now it's all about how much money they get for doing as little 
work as possible.

So fuck them, and fuck all of you who say you should watch the ads. I don't 
have cable because I don't want to be bothered with ads, what makes you 
think I want to be bothered with it online? I am not turning off adblock, 
and companies can try all they want to block adblock because the community 
that don't want ads is much smarter than them and WILL break through their 
bullshit and ads will be blocked. Either you get used to it or not, 
companies need to get off their asses and find a better way to make money, 
and so do these full time youtubers.
comments.author: CF-105 Games

comments.text:
+snake2006 Right, you don't owe the 'Leave a penny' anything either. I'm 
not saying you 'owe' them, I'm saying it's weird that you're so proud of 
the fact you use adblocker. These amazing people are able to create more 
content as long as we sit through a few seconds of ads. it's so weird that 
you're proud of the fact that you're undermining that process.

It's kinda meaningless that you don't consider it a 'real job'. If making 
money by doing something that people love is a fake job, real jobs sound 
awful. 

I'm not saying you're a thief and that you owe these people something. It's 
just bizarre that you seem to like their videos (why else would you be 
watching them?) but you're proud of the fact that you're actively not 
contributing to helping them make these videos when it's SOOO easy to just 
watch the dang ads. If for no other reason then the fact that they 
appreciate it.
comments.author: OutSpeak Debate 토론

comments.text:
+OutSpeak Debate

No,it's more that I don't owe these youtubers anything. If they don't like 
the money they get then they should get a real job.

comments.text:
